1)a) \(2\int \sin (2x) \, dx\)→ Substitution\(2x = u\)\(\frac{du}{dx} = 2\)
\(2\cdot 1\)
Grenzen anpassen\(dx = \frac{1}{2} \, du\)
\(= 2\int \sin u \cdot \frac{1}{2} \, du = \frac{1}{2} 2\int \sin u \, du\)
b)\(a\int \frac{1}{x} \, dx = \lim_{b \to \infty} a\int \frac{1}{x} \, dx = \lim_{b \to \infty}[ \ln x ]_a^b = \lim_{b \to \infty} (\ln b - \ln a)\)→ ∞konvergiet nicht
c)Rächensofa: \(f(x, y) = 1\)→ sonst bei zweifachintegral Volumen
\(\iint\limits_{y} 1 \, dx \, dy = A\)
2)\(f(x, y) = \sqrt{5 + x^2 + y^2}\)
a)\(f(0; 2) = \sqrt{5 + 0^2 + 2^2} = \sqrt{9} = 3\)✓
b)\(f(x, y) = z\)equibt "Röche" in 3D, man erhöht Punkte \((x, y, z)\)
c)\(f(x, y) = L\)\(L \in \mathbb{R}\)
\(\sqrt{5 + x^2 + y^2} = L\)\(L^2\)
\(5 + x^2 + y^2 = L^2\)\(-5 - x^2\)
\(y^2 = L^2 - 5 - x^2\)\(-7\)
\(y = \pm \sqrt{L^2 - 5 - x^2}\)→ nun 2 Variablen, man also kein Objekt in 3D somit Sphäre sein
\(= R^2\)
Kreis um Ursprung mit \(R = \sqrt{L^2 - 5}\)⇒ Kreis in \((x, y)\)-Ebene
